p: In addition, the voltinism of C. krombeini was estimated based on two different types of biofix for degree-day accumulation each year (i.e., determining the first date for degree-day accumulation): one with calendar date of January 1 st and the other with the predicted date for the emergence of O. cornifrons adults in spring. Osmia cornifrons adults generally emerge in April in West Virginia [ 20] and phoretic deutonymphs of C. krombeini need to move to a new bee nest by hitchhiking on newly-emerging Osmia bees. Therefore, the biofix using the predicted date of spring emergence for O. cornifrons adults could reflect more realistic life cycle of C. krombeini in the field. Spring emergence date of O. cornifrons adults was predicted by calculating the degree-day accumulation up to 126.1 DD with LDT and UDT of 10.5°C and 46.2°C, respectively, which were reported in a previous study on O. cornifrons [ 20]. Degree-day calculations were done with single sine/vertical cutoff methods [ 39]. After obtaining the predicted date of O. cornifrons adult emergence as a biofix, the degree-days for C. krombeini development were accumulated.
